review_blob: Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Pretty hoppy. Unfortunately tried this at the end of the share. Thx HankDaStank.
beer_name: Three Floyds Blot Out the Sun

review_blob: Vanilla. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Thx tim. Almost coconut but i known its not.
beer_name: 2nd Shift Liquid Spiritual Delight: Tennessee Whiskey (Vanilla)

review_blob: Very tart. Dry. Very dark straw. Very puckering. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share.
Dark brown. Lots of oak. Oxidized. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Good not great.
Yellow. Tart. Earthy. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Peach. Thx carter.
Tart but fades away quickly. Very smooth. Like a sweet tart. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Thx tim.
Dark black. Thin head. Chocolate. Oily. Not sure why this is top 50. Oak. Very drinkable. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share. Thx robertdale!
beer_name: Stone Imperial Russian Stout - Bourbon Barrel

review_blob: Woody. Cloudy. Oxidized. Carboard. Thx carter. Not boozy. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share.
beer_name: North Coast Old Stock Cellar Reserve (Bourbon Barrel)

review_blob: Really sweet. Some woody. Tastes like brandy. Side by side w bourbon variant. Thx maltser85. Tasted at my Outdoor bottle share.
beer_name: North Coast Old Stock Cellar Reserve (Brandy Barrel)

review_blob: UPDATED: APR 22, 2016
UPDATED: APR 21, 2016
Light brown. Frothy head. Pretty acidic, almost to the point of tartness. Like cheap coffee. I was looking forward to this, and feel let down. Thx Erin!

Dark brown, almost black. Hello coconut! Lots of coconut. Some white chocolate. This is amazing. Very subtle coffee. I cant recall giving a 10 for taste before now. (maybe CBS?) Not a booze bomb. Enjoyed in my hammock. Thanks RobertDale for this gem! I want more.
Dark black. Silky velvety smooth, but not thick and heavy. Not a barrel bomb at all. Subtle rum.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Barrel Aged Silk Porter

review_blob: Whoa...super hoppy...but doesnt linger. Grapefruit rinds. Pretty tasty. Thx Anthony.
Thick chocolate. Black. Subtle oak. These are the kinds of BA stouts I enjoy....it isnt a booze bomb, and then bourbon is super subtle. Thanks bu11zeye for this generous throw in!

Incredibly thick. Used motor oil. Chewy. Smells like chocolate. Taste like smoke and ancho chilies. Mexican chocolate. Chipotle. Wow, this is good. Would be nice side by side with an Abraxas. Another gem sent my way by Malster85.
Dark black. Sweet. Almost under-fermented sweet. Cola. Claims to be full body, but is actually somewhat thin. Growler that was a wedding git from Joey.

Dark black. Medium khaki head. Tasted side by side with regular version. Thick and chewy. Roasted. Strong oak flavor...almost too much for me. Lasting bourbon. I liked the regular version better, this one masks the great toast flavor behind lots of bourbon woodiness. Enjoyed after running my 5th marathon. Thx JSquire.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Bourbon Barrel Aged Siberian Night

review_blob: Dark black. Medium khaki head. Tasted side by side with BA version. Thick and chewy. Roasted. Perfectly, and I mean perfectly cooked toast. Lasting roastiness. Enjoyed after running my 5th marathon.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Siberian Night Imperial Stout

review_blob: Peanut Butter. Reeses pieces. Thick peanut head. I dig this. Glad it is reasonable ABV. Im kind of impressed with the head retention despite addy something oily/fatty like peanuts. Crowler while relaxing in my hammock. Life is good! Thx Malster85!
Dark black. Sweet. Tastes kind of like whoppers. Milk, but somewhat artificial milk. Good, but not something id seek out again.
On tap. Tastes like abraxas without all the spices. Thick. Sticky. Kinda sweet.
beer_name: Side Project Barrel-Aged Coffee Crawl Stout

review_blob: Strong coffee. Amazing smell. Sweet. Dark black. Shared with carter at the cellar.
beer_name: Side Project Barrel-Aged Coffee Crawl Stout - Arthouse Coffee

review_blob: UPDATED: APR 2, 2016
Nice blonde. A bit unique as it isnt super light. Has some body. Tasted at wine 33.
Dark black. Thin tan head. Delicious! Milk chocolate at first, then rounds out to gentle warming roastiness. Nice caramel and toffee flavor. Thx bu11zeye!
Strangely Allagash Black is actually brown. Stick head/lacing. Brown sugar. Quite yeasty. Crusty toast. Hints of coffee. Dry.  Thx jow.

Cool, old school pull tab can. I havent done a pull tab since I was under 21. Very clear yellow. Quite aggressively effervescent. Interesting. Biscuity. Somewhat sweet. Candy corn. Thanks Zheng for bringing this back from China for me! I could drink a lot of these. Its not a horrible fizzy yellow beer....but its not something you drink just one of.
Lots of coffee. No head. Smooth. Dark black. Tasted at jims bday. Delicious.

Dark thick black. Quite bitter, like chewing on a handful of unsweetened cocoa nibs. A little overwhelming but Im pretty sure that was their goal....I want banana or strawberries or something else that I typically use to make nibs bearable. At least its nice and creamy at the end.  Thx Whereisyourball.  Enjoyed in my backyard hammock!
beer_name: Stone 20th Anniversary Encore Series: Bitter Chocolate Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: Brown. Very thin. Sweet. Extract like maltines. I was expecting more from this.
Dark black. Nice balance of coffee and cocoa nibs. No head. Quite drinkable. On tap at cuginos.
UPDATED: APR 22, 2016

Dark Black. Thick foamy mocha head. Thick creamy coffee. Acidic. Very roasted, almost espresso like. Charred. If you like dark coffee, then youll like this. A bit bitter. Id prefer more milkiness or chocolate, as is its in your face dark roasted coffee (and I like dark coffee).  Somewhat peppery.  Porch beer on a beautiful day!
Black. This is confusing to me. Very dry. Roasted...almost burnt but not smokey. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016
Coffee, a lot of coffee. Is missing something i cant place. Very acidic. Medium body. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Black. Extremely dry finish. Cotton mouth dry. Not a fan. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
beer_name: New English Bine & Vine 4th Anniversary Ale - Adams Avenue Imperial Porter

review_blob: Holy cow. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party. Seriously this came from a holy cow. Hershey syrup. Smells like milk. Tastes like chocolate milk w a hint. of caramel.
beer_name: Omnipollo / Prairie Omniprairie aka Abundantia Milk Choc. Caramel Stout

review_blob: Black. Mediocre next to other options here. Pretty hoppy. Is this a black ipa? Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Hazy dark copper. Peach. Refreshing. Easy to drink. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Thick and creamy. Tons of mocha. Chocolate. Coffee. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party. This is totally my thing.
Purple. Incredibly. Really light. Blueberry is hard to cut through but this does so well. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Brown. Subtle. Decent but prefer the balaton i just had. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party.
Really good. Red. Puckering. Cherries. Refreshing. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
More chocolate than regular. Oak. Liked this Much better than cognac. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
This is really boozy. Too much for me. Apple. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Strong coffee smell and taste. Sweet. Wow this is good. Tasted at stlhops 8th anniversary party
Smells boozy. Boozy. Hot. Woody. Tasted at dars for march madness. The Chris.
beer_name: Free State Owd Macs Imperial Stout
